featured.text: Unable to attend music school, she began her career as a singer for church gatherings.
Then she returned to the U.S. in 1935 and became a top concert singer after performing at Town Hall in New York City.
The singers usually sing popular folk songs.
The singers learn to sing from their parents.
Marian Anderson (1897-1993) was an African American woman who gained fame as a concert singer in this climate of racism.

definition.zh_def: 歌手，指以演唱歌曲為職業或愛好的人。
definition.en_def: A person who sings, especially professionally.
definition.example: The singer captivated the audience with her powerful voice.
